General Service.question: What services are provided on IoT SIM card?
General Service.answer:
This OneSimCard IoT SIM card connectivity solution also offers data and SMS service in over 200 countries worldwide with many countries offering redundant networks. This global IoT SIM card operates on a single APN and on OneSimCard IoT’s OSCAR IoT SIM management platform, making multi-country deployments simple. Included with the service, you will have free access to OSCAR – our powerful, yet easy to use, cloud based IoT SIM card management platform where you will have sophisticated management tools for your entire deployment.
The main features of the OSCAR Platform are:
  • Activate/deactivate/block (suspend) IoT SIM cards
  • Set IoT SIM card Data Connection options and limits
  • Suspend/Un-Suspend any IoT SIM card
  • Assign administrators to specific groups of IoT SIM cards
  • Assign various user rights to accounts administrators
  • Assign “nicknames” to IoT SIM cards for easier management
  • Send/Receive SMS directly from portal or API at reduced cost
  • Basic Troubleshooting, IoT SIM card network reconnect, and Active Session information
    • Lock IoT SIM cards to a particular IMEI
  • Set up “Activation Templates” for frequently used settings
  • Assign/Unassign Static IP Addresses to IoT SIM cards
  • Set future deactivation/suspend dates for IoT SIM cards
  • Full API access to IoT SIM card Management functions
  • Set alarms/notifications if IoT SIM card(s) meet certain criteria
  • Voice service is available, and requires a particular type of IoT SIM card. If you require Voice, please mention this when you fill out the Custom Quote Request form
  • Private APN, VPN and Static IPs for additional security measures
  • IP Filtering - Whitelist IP addresses from which and to which data is transferred (optional services required)

General Service.question: What network coverage is offered on IoT SIM Card?
General Service.answer:
OneSimCard M2M IoT SIM works on major networks of the countries where it is being used. For example, in USA the service is offered on AT&T, T-Mobile, and Verizon Networks. In Canada the service is offered on Rogers, Telus or Bell. The switching between networks is automatic and not steered. The networks with the strongest signal will be selected to provide the best quality of service.

You can view networks offered in each country on the Coverage page.

General Service.question: What is the expiration policy for OneSimCard IoT SIM cards?
General Service.answer: For PAYG accounts, the OneSimCard IoT SIM card will expire 60 days after the date when there is no balance on the IoT SIM (except on newer accounts where the IoT SIM cards are not individually funded). Both PAYG and Pooled accounts’ IoT SIM cards may expire if there is no usage in 18 consecutive months. See full Terms and Conditions

General Service.question: Will I be able to see the usage details for my IoT SIM card?
General Service.answer: Yes, all data usage and IoT SIM activity can be tracked in real-time from the web portal or via our API endpoints.

General Service.question: Will I be able to see the usage details for my IoT SIM card?
General Service.answer:
All usage details and charges are available in the OSCAR IoT SIM management portal. These records can also be downloaded as a CSV File from the IoT SIM card page of the OSCAR portal. These downloads are available for 1 month at a time, going back 2 years.

In addition, you can filter IoT SIM cards using the following parameters in the reports section of the OSCAR Portal (certain parameters are not applicable to Pooled account):

  • IoT SIM cards with Data Package to be activated when the traffic starts moving
    • This option allows you to view those IoT SIM cards where data packages have been set up for activation to be triggered automatically once data is moving on the IoT SIM.
  • IoT SIM cards with data packages scheduled to get activated later
    • This option displays IoT SIM cards with data packages scheduled to be activated on a particular date.
  • Iot SIM with the balance below X
    • This option displays IoT SIM cards with low balances that might need your attention to ensure service is not interrupted due to lack of funds.
  • IoT SIM cards with the data usage over the last X DAYS above Y MB
    • This option displays IoT SIM cards with the data usage exceeding your projected usage or could be used for other usage monitoring applications.
  • IoT SIM cards with the $ spending – Top X % in 30 days
    • This option displays IoT SIM cards that are consuming the most funds for data and SMS usage.
  • IoT SIM cards that reached monthly additions limit
    • If monthly spending limits for IoT SIM cards are set, this option allows you to view IoT SIM cards that already reached the monthly limit and are temporarily not in service until additional funds are added.
  • IoT SIM cards 10% below monthly additions limit
    • This option allows you to view the range of IoT SIM cards that are about to reach the monthly limit (If you have set limits on the IoT SIM cards.

Alarms can also be set in OSCAR to proactively notify you if certain criteria are met, Alarms include:

  • For PAYG accounts:
    • IoT SIM cards with data usage for the past X days above X MB
    • IoT SIM cards with no data usage for the last X days
    • IoT SIM cards with no usage (data and SMS) for the last X days
    • IoT SIM cards with Data Package used up before the package renewal date
    • IoT SIM cards with data packages used X % of package data
    • IoT SIM with the balance below $X
    • IoT SIM cards that reached monthly additions limit
    • IoT SIM cards 10% below monthly additions limit
    • IoT SIM cards sends X SMS within X days
    • IoT SIM cards used more than X minutes within X days
  • For Pooled accounts:
    • IoT SIM cards sends X SMS within X days
    • IoT SIM cards with data usage for the past X days above X MB
    • IoT SIM cards with no data usage for the last X days
    • IoT SIM cards with no usage (data and SMS) for the last X days
    • IoT SIM cards with the usage X % over allotment
    • When total pool reaches  X% of the allotment

Rates And Cost.question: What kind of networks are available with OneSimCard M2M / IoT?
Rates And Cost.answer: Currently we offer 2G, 3G & 4G (full LTE, CAT M/M1, & NB-IoT ) networks in most countries we cover.  Speeds and network type are dependent on the networks on which we operate. For full details, please fill out a Custom Quote Request form and have a discussion with our IoT experts.

Ordering.question: What kind of networks are available with OneSimCard M2M / IoT?
Ordering.answer: Currently we offer 2G, 3G & 4G (full LTE, CAT M/M1, & NB-IoT) networks in most countries we cover. Speeds and network type are dependent on the networks on which we operate. For full details, please fill out a Custom Quote Request form and have a discussion with our IoT experts.

Terminology.question: What does M2M mean?
Terminology.answer: M2M stands for Machine-to-Machine, referring to direct communication between devices over the internet or cellular networks.

OSCAR IoT SIM MP.question: What is OSCAR IoT SIM MP?
OSCAR IoT SIM MP.answer: It’s our Multi-Profile IoT SIM card that supports multiple operator profiles on a single chip for enhanced network redundancy.

OneSim IoT App.question: What features are available in the OneSim IoT App?
OneSim IoT App.answer: The app lets you monitor data usage, activate SIMs, and configure alerts for each connected device.

IoT Track SIM.question: What is IoT Track SIM?
IoT Track SIM.answer: It’s a GPS-enabled SIM solution designed for fleet management, asset tracking, and vehicle monitoring applications.
